result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt P Spang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Columbia County Court Conviction DNA Report - conviction DNA on file

9:57 AM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kurt P Spang in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Kurt P Spang. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 1,3, & 4 dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court sentenced the defendant on count 2 to serve 160 days in jail, with Huber, consecutive to any other sentence. $443.00 costs. Submit DNA sample. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. 120 days credit for a time served sentence. 10:16 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
